content.description: From a very high right-hand crimp and left-hand sloper lunge for the good flat edge. Head straight up the tall face, passing the cool grainy slot on the way.
content.location: Upon reaching Fern Gully, head toward the backside of the most downcanyon and downhill large boulder. This boulder hosts Mount Warning on the far left of the face as well as a number of other great climbs.

content.description: Start with your right hand on an obvious high crimp, which is the left hand start hold of Fairy Slipper (V4). Climb up and left on crimps to sloping orange side pulls. Climb directly left from the orange side pulls, finishing on the left side of the tall face.
content.location: This route is located on the tall boulder down and right where you enter the fern gully area. See Do You Believe in Fairies (V1) for a further description on finding the boulder. The Hexxus Project climbs the center of the wide SE face. This variation starts in the center moving left through obvious orange side pulls, then further left into the top out for Mount Warning (V3), which climbs the obvious left side of the tall face.

content.description: Start with your right hand on the high start crimp of Fairy Slipper. Climb up and left to the sloping orange sidepull, then finish up and right on poor crimps.
content.location: Climbs the middle of the Hexxus boulder face. Look for the distinct orange sidepull at mid height.

content.description: On the right face of the boulder, start with a high left-hand side pull and a right hand crimp. Climb up and right on opposing side pulls to top out above the scoop. Some of the right hand holds are shared with Do You Believe in Fairies (V1).
content.location: Once you reach the fern gully area veer right, crossing over a log or two. You’ll come to the back side of a tall boulder. Walk around to the obvious wide face. Do You Believe in Fairies climbs the scoop on the right, while Fairy Slipper starts just to the left of the scoop.

content.description: Climb the scoop with incut sidepulls and a strange triangular foothold. Very cool movement for a V1 and a little crimpier than expected
content.location: Follow the obvious trail from the start of the group of boulders about 20 feet up to small log , and then turn right and walk down about 10 feet to the large boulder. The problem is just left of the arete.

content.description:
From a very low and flexing flake make some huge moves upward to establish on the arete. Slap your way to the top out. Fun.

The higher start makes for a great V4 and will likely become standard when the flake breaks.
content.location: Upon reaching Fern Gully, head toward the backside of the most downcanyon and downhill large boulder. This boulder hosts Batty Koda on the downhill arete as well as a number of other great climbs.
